intro: Castilleja hyssopifolia, commonly known as the hyssopleaf Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its vivid red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, erect stems and small, scale-like leaves that help it blend into its surroundings. It forms symbiotic relationships with certain host plants, drawing nutrients through specialized root structures. Castilleja hyssopifolia is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands.
